subject: Psychology
title: Similarity and Attraction
description: A 60-second lesson on Similarity and Attraction.

hook.text: 'Opposites attract' makes a great movie plot. In real life, research says similar people attract far more often.

buildup.text: Byrne's law of attraction shows that attitude similarity is one of the strongest predictors of liking.

discovery.text: Similar values, humor, and backgrounds create rapport. We feel understood and validated by similar others.

twist.text: Complementarity plays a role too â€” but mainly in skills, not personalities. We like people who think like us.

climax.text: Similarity provides the comfort. Shared values provide the glue. Opposites may attract briefly, but similarity sustains.

punchline.text: Birds of a feather don't just flock. They stay together.

quiz.question: What does research say about similarity and attraction?
options: Similar people are more attracted to each other
Similarity has no effect on relationships
